detailsOfAchievement: RUDI is established with clear objectives of promoting integrated development of the poor people in rural & urban areas in our country through innovative income generation approach & awareness campaigning with training & workshop. RUDI is also actively engaged in increasing funding & improve policies for family planning, creating public partnerships to expand birth control awareness & options to develop innovative & affordable contraceptive methods a& nd support further research to narrow knowledge gaps. We are particularly committed to exploring how our family planning efforts can make substantial difference to population outburst through continuous awareness camps to promote "Small Family-Happy Family" concept & by distributing contraceptive pills & other birth control instruments for a economically and socially better India. We also implemented few sectors to work on - "Fair Price Pathology" (To reduce the Health Expenses), "Institute of Health Professions" (Income Generation Program for Youths), "Annopurna - Hunger Free India" (Free Meals to children, beggars & others), "BISWAMONI" (Free education to Children), Global Warming & other awareness activities.

sourceOfFunds.purpose: Self funded organisation. We generate funds and support our organisation and social activity by running some profitable projects like Uneed Medical, a profitable Healthcare Service unit. We run many social projects like ANNOPURNA, RIGHT TO BE HEALTHY, GENERAL AWARENESS PROGRAM, EDUCATION FOR CHILDREN, FREE PATHOLOGY SUPPORT FOR CANCER PATIENT ETC.

detailsOfAchievement: Main focus of Rural Development Association is food and income security of the underprivileged communities, i.e, STs and SCs living in the remote forest fringed rural areas of West medinipur District of WB and East Singbhum Dist of Jharkhand. majority of the referral communities belong to Tribal, Santhals, Mundas, Bhumij and Lodhas. For implementation of the activities community level organisation like Women Self help Groups ( WSHG) , Village organisations ( VO) have been promoted for active participation of the communities in their development process. So far 643 WSHGs and 61 VOs have been promoted and functional. Membership of the WSHGs ranges from 10-20, Livelihood activities are based on Natural Resource Management. Agriculture, plantation, Development of water structures for small and critical irrigation, animal rearing are the main livelihood activities. Total farmers covered so far is more than 4000 and 521 water structures have been created. 18 nos. of Water users Association ( WUA) looks after needs of the farmers and distribution of water as per need. under plantation program forest species like Acacia and Gamhar and fruit plants like mango, guava, lime etc have been planted on fallow lands. A Seed Production and processing unit has been developed for foundation seed of paddy in Sankrail Block of West Medinipur District of WB and Seed production activity has been going on in East Singbhum Disrrict too. These program are supported by Tata Trust and NABARD. Animal rearing covers goat units. Those are mainly for women in distress and landless families. presently there are 1194 goat units. Those apart, RDA runs Family Counselling Centre for amicable settlement of family disputes, prevent violance on women and providing administrative and legal help. FCC has been sponsored by Central Social Welfare Board, Govt. of India since 1986. RDA has also been working on Protection of Child Rights, protection of children from abuses and development of children belonging to underprivileged communities.

detailsOfAchievement: Sabuj Sangha is a non-profit, non-government development organization committed to improving the lives of people less fortunate in West Bengal, India, through participation and empowerment. It was established in the Sundarban region of West Bengal and is registered in 1975 under the West Bengal Societies Registration Act 1961. Sabuj Sangha implements programmes in various sectors, catering to the needs of vulnerable communities. The organization believes that there is no simple solution to reduce/eradicate poverty. For this reason, Sabuj Sangha adopts an Integrated Sustainable Development Model, which works in five main thematic areas, in 3 diarists of West Bengal Jalpaiguri, Kolkata and South 24 Parganas:  Health and Nutrition  Water, Sanitation and Hygiene  Education and Protection  Livelihood and Womens Empowerment  Environment and Disaster Response The number of beneficiaries, areas and working experience of Sabuj Sangha:  The number of direct beneficiaries: 150,000  The number of indirect beneficiaries: 450,000  Health Care  19 years  Education  15 years  Community Development  34 years  Disaster Relief, Rehabilitation and Risk Reduction  12 years  Water & Sanitation  20 years  Agriculture  17 years  Gender Issues  10 years  Micro finance(SHG)  19 years  Livelihood  15 years  Child & Youth Activities  16 years  Rights and entitlements  5  Social security for elderly-5years

title: SAPTAYAN
detailsOfAchievement: ACTIVITIES AND ACHEIVEMENTS SAPTAYAN, is one organisation which was established in the year 1970 (Registered in 1974) in order to provide a new platform to the budding and talented young generation in the fields of music, dance & dance-drama and promote artists, poets, dancers, musicians, singers and dramatists. Since then Saptayan has been regularly producing and presenting various musical and dance events and programmes which include Workshop cum Training, Seminar and Symposia in various districts of West Bengal as well as in other states. It has been training people for a brilliant career in the field of Music, Dance and other related subjects. The soil of Bengal has always been very rich for its cultural heritage. It has produced many artists, poets, lyricists, dancers, musicians, singers and dramatists, who have been the inspiration of new generation. In spite, most of the young talents often remain unrecognized and unknown in the absence of a common and organized platform. Saptayan has performed various productions and programmes in All India Radio, Kolkata as well as in Doordarshan, Kolkata (Prasar Bharati) since the year 1980 and it was affiliated to the Rabindra Bharati University, Kolkata. Saptayan is also having its various wings, where children and young people are being trained in various cultural activities, which includes a sizeable representation form backward communities like SC, ST, OBC, etc. Mission To preserve and promote art in all its forms like Music, Dance, Dance Drama, Children & Youth Cultural Exchange with particular emphasize on the traditional and rich cultural heritage of Bengal. To give special attention to the development of cultural faculties in children and youth who are our hopes for the future. To search fresh talent and induct them in the fields of Dance, Dance Drama, Music, Children & Youth Cultural Exchange. To provide opportunities to amateur artists to develop an all around personality of Leadership and to display their talents at national and international levels. To bring the people of our land on a common platform of culture and arts and to form a common bond of love and understanding towards World Peace! To participate in similar activities at national level to exchange and compare the notes. To participate in similar activities in foreign countries to present the aspects of our civilization and culture before them and to invite them to India for similar participation of them. To instill in our youth patriotism and yet a national outlook through travel and cultural exchange to promote the national integration amongst them. To provide opportunity towards education in human values among the teenagers through art in all its forms. For, Saptayan, excellence is not only the destination, its ambition and goal is to create awareness among society to keep and sustain cultural values and heritage of India and tradition alive. The March is on! Show Must Go on. Recognised by : All India Radio, Kolkata, Door Darshan Kendra, Kolkata (Prasar Bharati, Govt. of India), Ministry of Culture, Govt. of India, Sangeet Natak Akademi, New Delhi, Department of Culture, Govt. of West Bengal. Affiliated to : Rabindra Bharati University (Govt. of West Bengal)

detailsOfAchievement: Sarba Shanti Ayog was set up with a vision to empower the marginalised artisan community through capacity building and market access. Sarba Shanti Ayog is an enabling platform for building Fair Trade Business at the grassroots level. Sarba Shanti Ayog renders services of technical assistance, financial access and social developmental of the producer collectives, NGOs and Social enterprises. The services are extended to new potential craft groups, small enterprises, Fair Trade organisations and development organisations with focus on livelihood promotion and enterprise development. The interventions, activities and services have resulted in increased capacities of the target groups, improvement in their assets, tools, skills and operational efficiency. It has eased their financial bottlenecks and provides access to timely and relevant information. The know-how inputs have resulted in better quality, lesser failures, new products, improved productivity all resulting in greater customer servicing. More importantly all these grassroots business have internalized and demonstrate transparency, participation, equity of gender, rights of the children and care for environment, working conditions and welfare. Enterprises serviced by SSA follow fair business practices, committed to produce sustainable, authentic and well-designed craft and food items and are sensitive towards resources, energy, pollution, effluents etc. They have been sensitized towards working for the welfare of its people. The unique and participative model has resulted in a strong network of producer associations and networks that self manage its affairs and constantly strives for excellence in servicing the customer and benefiting the communities.

detailsOfAchievement: The organization was established in 1986 with the objectives to eradicate poverty, illiteracy and superstition for the establishment of a peaceful, nonviolent & just society. In the beginning of the organization from 1987 we undertook the activities on child education, awareness of rural people, vocational training of the women and unemployed youth. After that we implemented various activities in 15 villages under Bhagwanpur  I block in Purba Medinipur district. During this time we run 15 Non formal education centres, vocational training cum production centre on weaving, tailoring, wool knitting, carpentry, plantation, excavation of about 150 ponds, training on organic farming, construction of 50 compost pits, 300 low cost toilets & 800 smokeless Chullahs for ecological development, installation of shallow tube wells for agriculture development, installation of 17 tube wells for supplying drinking water, small savings & micro finance with about 1,000 women, etc. From 2001 we are working on Water & sanitation for both community and schools. Total 160 community tube wells and 25 school water supply programmes have been implemented in Purba Midnapur district. Very recent five big water filtration plants have been installed in five high schools. Besides this one eye care centre namely VIDYASAGAR EYE CARE CENTRE has been established in 2002 to control blindness and provide eye treatment facilities to the local people in very low cost/free of cost. This centre has license from local Govt. Health Department. . Total about 5,000 cataract operations have been done through this centre so far. Under national programme for control blindness (NPCB) we are receiving grant from local district health department for free cataract operation of the poor people. Screening camps are being organized different remote villages to identify the cataract patients. Moreover, we are running a nursery school namely HAMATMA GANDHI SISHU SIKSHA SADAN from 2003 to provide all-round better quality education to the children of this area with moderate fees. There is total 383 students are now in this school. Besides regular school education we are imparting training on Yoga, drawing, dance, games and sports etc. to our students. Regular reports are being submitted to local Govt. school authority/department. To perform all these activities this organization has been able to raise fund various state, national and international donor agencies like BFW, EZE Germany, IDS, India Abroad USA, Water Aid U.K. HAVE & Rotary Club of Haliburton  Canada, CAPART New Delhi, Social Welfare advisory board, New Delhi, Rotary Club of Belur, Gandhi Peace Centre Hydrabad, Gandhi Smriti & Darshan Samity, New Delhi, IGSSS, New Delhi, Nehru Yuba Kendra, and many local generous donors.
